message.content:
cs.ET, cs.NE, cs.AR, cs.SY, cs.CV

The paper discusses a novel computing architecture for training large deep neural networks using computational memory units with nanoscale resistive memory devices. This suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-categories of cs.ET (Emerging Technologies), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), cs.AR (Hardware Architecture), cs.SY (Systems and Control), or cs.CV (Computer Vision). However, since the paper focuses on the implementation of deep learning models using computational memory, cs.ET and cs.NE are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also evaluates the proposed architecture on a wide class of networks, including convolutional neural networks and generative-adversarial networks, which further supports the possibility of cs.CV being a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper includes a system-level study on the energy efficiency of the proposed architecture, which suggests that cs.SY could also be a possible sub-category.
